dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2056 EH: District of Columbia Federal Immigration Compliance Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.official-title: To require the District of Columbia to comply with federal immigration laws.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the District of Columbia Federal Immigration Compliance Act of 2025.

section.header: Prohibition on District of Columbia serving as sanctuary jurisdiction
section.text: The District of Columbia may not have in effect a statute, ordinance, policy, or practice that prohibits or restricts any entity or official of the District government fromâ€”

paragraph.text: sending, receiving, maintaining, or exchanging with any Federal, State, or local government entity information regarding the citizenship or immigration status (lawful or unlawful) of any individual; or

complying with a request lawfully made by the Department of Homeland Security under section 236 or 287 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1226 and 1357) to comply with a detainer for, or notify about the release of, an individual.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives June 12, 2025.
